title: Protocol to detect infectious SARS-CoV-2 at low levels using in situ hybridization techniques
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
      For both assays, cells need to be infected following steps 1–14. For
      quantifying infection by the FISH-flow assay, follow steps 15–23, and for
      evaluating the infection with the morphological RNAscope assay, follow
      steps 24–57.
    
Infection of Vero cells
Timing: 24 h
      In this step, Vero cells are incubated with various amounts of infectious
      virus with indicated multiplicity of infection (MOI) ranging from 0.01 to
      0.00001, thus including a condition with low infectious virus
      concentration (< 10 infectious virus/mL), not detectable in techniques
      such as plaque forming assays or RT-qPCR, this later one being sensitive
      but unable to discriminate infectious from non-infectious virus.
    
      This protocol applies to the detection of low levels of infectious virus
      produced by different cells in ex vitro or in vitro culture
      systems.
    
        Seed cells in D10 in a 96-flat well plate so that a layer of confluent
        cells can be infected with the virus on the day of infection (usually
        50,000 cells/well the day before). Anticipate having at least 3
        replicates per dilution of virus tested and per sample in order to
        ensure robustness of the detection.
      
        Perform 10-fold serial dilutions of viral stocks or biological samples
        in DMEM supplemented with Penicillin/streptomycin (100 U/mL) and 2% FCS
        (D2).
      
Critical: Addition of 1% final
      TPCK-treated trypsin might increase detection of infectious particles from
      biological samples in Vero E6 cells that lack expression of the protease
      TMPRSS2.5[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib5]
Infect cells with 50 μL viral dilution for 1–3 h at 37°C.
Replace inoculum with 100 μL fresh pre-warmed D2.
Incubate Vero cells for 24 h at 37°C, 5% CO2.
Wash two times Vero cells with PBS-FISH.
        Detach Vero cells by incubating them in Trypsin 0.05% v/v solution for
        5 min at 37°C, 5% CO2.
        
Add 50 μL trypsin/well.

After the 5 min incubation, add 100 μL D2 to neutralize trypsin, and
            then transfer cells to a round bottom plate.
          
            Wash the wells of the culture plate with 100 μL PBS and transfer
            cells to the corresponding wells of a round bottom plate.
          
Centrifuge cells at 300 × g for 10 min and remove media.
        Before staining with RNA probes for FISH-flow, perform a viability
        staining with 50 μL Viobility 405/452 diluted in PBS (final dilution
        1:100), 5 min on ice.
      
        Add 200 μL PBS and centrifuge cells at 300 x g for 5 min to remove the
        excess of Viobility staining solution.
      
        Resuspend cell pellets with 4% v/v paraformaldehyde and incubate for
        30 min for cell fixation.
      
        Remove fixative by washing cells three times with PBS-FISH using the
        same centrifugation settings as in step 8.
      
Reserve cells in suspension for FISH-flow.
        Make dry spots of the fixed Vero cells on poly-L-Lysine-coated slides
        for RNAscope.
        
            Resuspend 105 cells in 20 μL of PBS without calcium and
            magnesium.
          
            Drop the 20 μL of cell suspension on the poly-L-Lysine-coated slide.
            Deposit a maximum of two to three drops per slide.
          
Allow drying at 20°C–23°C for 2 h.
Store slides at 4°C until the RNAscope assay is run.
Quantification of infection by FISH-flow
Note: In the FISH-flow assay,
      in situ hybridization step is performed
      after immunolabeling.
    
Immunolabeling for FISH-flow
Timing: 1 h
      In this step, cells will be permeabilized for intracellular immunolabeling
      of the SARS-CoV-2 spike protein. This step is performed before
in situ hybridization.
    
        Resuspend cells in solution of primary antibodies diluted in
        PERM-FISH-Tween or PERM-FISH-Sapo buffer.
        
            Dilute Alexa Fluor 488-conjugated anti-S1 antibody at 1:250 in any
            perm buffer.
          
Add 50 μL of diluted antibody solution per well.
Mix the cells.
Incubate for 30 min at 20°C–23°C.

Add 200 μL PERM-FISH-Tween or PERM-FISH-Sapo to the wells.
        Wash out PERM-FISH-Tween buffer containing antibody by pelleting down
        the cells at 300 x g, 5 min, 20°C–23°C and resuspend cells in 200 μL
        HWB.
      
Pause point: Immunolabeled cells
      can be stored up to 16–18 h in HWB at 4°C.
    
In situ hybridization for FISH-flow
Timing: 1 day
      In this step, to detect viral RNA in immunolabeled cells, RNA probe sets
      tagged with Quasar 670 (a fluorophore alternative of Cy5) will be
      hybridized to SARS-CoV-2 RNA.
    
        Washout HWB and resuspend immunolabeled cells in HB10%dx buffer
        containing the combined probe sets.
        
            Final probe concentration is 50 nM. For the combination of 4
            different probe sets, as used in this assay, use 12.5 nM of each
            probe set diluted in HB10%dx buffer.
          
            If necessary, pre-dilute probes from probe stock solutions using
            Nuclease-free water as diluent.
          
            Avoid bubbles when mixing probes in the HB10%dx buffer and when
            mixing cell with the HB10%dx buffer containing the probes.
          
            Use 50 μL of HB10%dx buffer containing the probes per reaction.
            Distribute samples in 96-well plates with round bottom.
          
Gently mix cells and probe-containing solution.
Critical: HB10%dx is viscous.
      Therefore prepare 10% more volume of the HB10%dx buffer solution
      containing the probes than actually required for the experiment.
    
        Seal the 96-well plate containing samples with an adhesive film or with
        parafilm.
      
Incubate 16–18 h at 37°C.
Critical: 16–18 h incubation must not
      exceed 16 h to avoid detection of false positives.
    
        Add 200 μL HWB to each well to wash out the HB10%dx buffer solution
        containing the probes and centrifuge at 300 x g for 5 min at 20°C–23°C.
        Repeat the procedure once. Resuspend cells in PBS without calcium and
        magnesium.
      
Pause point: Fixed samples can be

stored at 4°C for up to 7 days before flow cytometry analysis.
    
        Proceed for flow cytometry acquisition, in this protocol Guava 12-HT
        (Millipore) was used. Further analyze the flow cytometry data with
        dedicated software such as GuavaSoft 3.4 (Millipore) as used in the
        present study, or FlowJo (BD) as in Zhou et al.1[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib1]
        Outline of the gating strategy is presented in
        Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]A. As shown in
        Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]B, both viral RNA and Spike are detected in
        an MOI-dependent fashion. In the present context of acute infection,
        detection of viral RNA is usually more sensitive than that of Spike.

              Figure 1. Quantification of Vero cell infection by FISH-flow
            
              Cells were infected with low quantities of SARS-CoV-2 alpha
              variant (0.01 and 0.001 MOI) or left uninfected (non-infected) and
              incubated for 24 h at 37°C, labeled for viral RNA and spike
              protein and infection was quantified by flow cytometry.
            
              (A) Gating strategy using non-infected cells as negative control.
            
              (B) Quantification of cells expressing viral RNA
              (RNA+), spike protein (Spike+) and both the
              viral RNA and spike protein (RNA+Spike+).
              Values are shown as mean ± SEM (n = 3).
            
Morphological detection of infection by RNAscope
Note: In the RNAscope assay,
      in situ hybridization step is performed before immunolabeling.
    
In situ hybridization using RNAscope
Timing: 1 day
      In this step, SARS-CoV-2 genes are hybridized with RNAscope commercial
      probes, using RNAscope commercial kit as follows.
    
        Submerge the poly-L-lysine-coated slides containing dried spots of cell
        suspension in 100% v/v Ethanol solution in a Coplin jar for 1 min, for
        dehydration. Then, let the slide dry at 20°C–23°C.
      
Boil TRR in a heating plate until solution starts bubbling.
        Submerge the slides in the boiling TRR, reduce the heat of the heating
        plate by 30% and incubate for 30 min.

Wash slides in dH2O by 3–5 up-and-down movements. Repeat two
        times, changing dH2O each time.
      
        Wash slides in 100% v/v Ethanol by 2 up-and-down movements. Let slides
        dry at 20°C–23°C.
      
        Create a hydrophobic barrier around dried cell spots using a hydrophobic
        pen. Let the hydrophobic barrier dry for 5 min at 20°C–23°C.
      
        Add drops of Protease Plus solution on dried spots. Incubate slides at
        40°C for 5 min.
        
            During this time, pre-warm the RNAscope SARS-CoV-2 probe at 40°C.
          
        Wash slides in dH2O by 3–5 up-and-down movements. Repeat two
        times by changing the dH2O.
      
        Add drops of pre-warmed RNAscope SARS-CoV-2 probe on dried spots.
        Incubate slides in a humidified chamber at 40°C for 2 h.
        
            During this time, prepare the RWB keeping it at 37°C (materials and equipment[href=https://www.wicell.org#materials-and-equipment]).
          
        Wash slides by submerging them for 2 min in warmed RWB. Repeat one time
        by changing the RWB.
      
        Add drops of AMP1 on dried cell spots. Incubate slides in a humidified
        chamber at 40°C for 30 min.
      
        Wash slides by submerging them for 2 min in warmed RWB. Repeat one time
        by changing the RWB.
      
        Add drops of AMP2 on dried cell spots. Incubate slides in a humidified
        chamber at 40°C for 30 min.
      
        Wash slides by submerging them for 2 min in warmed RWB. Repeat one time
        by changing the RWB. Add drops of AMP3 on dried cell spots. Incubate
        slides in a humidified chamber at 40°C for 15 min.
      
        Wash slides by submerging them for 2 min in warmed RWB. Repeat one time
        by changing the RWB.
      
        Add drops of HRP-C1 on dried cell spots. Incubate slides in a humidified
        chamber at 40°C for 15 min.
      
        Wash slides by submerging them for 2 min in warmed RWB. Repeat one time
        by changing the RWB.

Prepare fluorescent dye solution Opal 570 during submersion time.
          
        Add drops of Opal 570 on dried cell spots. Incubate slides in a
        humidified chamber at 40°C for 30 min.
      
        Wash slides by submerging them for 2 min in warmed RWB. Repeat one time
        by changing the RWB.
      
        Add drops of HRP blocker on dried cell spots. Incubate slides in a
        humidified chamber at 40°C for 15 min.
      
        Wash slides by submerging them for 2 min in warmed RWB. Repeat one time
        by changing the RWB;
      
        Add drops of blocking buffer on dried cell spots. Incubate slides in a
        humidified chamber at 20°C–23°C for 2 h.
      
Pause point: Alternatively, slides
      can be stored in blocking buffer 16–18 h at 4°C.
    
Immunolabeling after RNAscope
Timing: 2 h
      In this step, cells will be permeabilized for intracellular immunolabeling
      of the SARS-CoV-2 spike protein. This step is performed after
      in situ hybridization.
    
        Remove blocking buffer and add drops of primary antibody diluted in
        blocking buffer.
        
            For antibody against SARS-CoV-2 spike protein, use 2 μg/mL
            concentration in 100 μL per reaction.
          
        Incubate 16–18 h at 4°C in a humidified chamber.
        
            This chamber can be built using a regular plastic box containing the
            slides and dH2O-soaked paper.
          
        Wash slides by submerging them in PBS without calcium and magnesium for
        5 min under mild tangential agitation. Repeat 2×.
      
        Add drops of secondary antibody diluted in blocking buffer.
        
            For immunolabeling of anti-SARS-CoV-2 spike protein antibody, use
            1:8000 (v/v) of AF488-coupled goat anti-mouse IgG1 antibody in
            100 μL per reaction.
          
Incubate for 2 h at 20°C–23°C.
        Wash slides by submersion in PBS without calcium and magnesium for 5 min
        under mild tangential agitation. Repeat 2×.
      
        Add 20 μL drops of 5 μg/mL DAPI solution in PBS without calcium and
        magnesium.

Wash slides by submersion in PBS without calcium and magnesium for 5 min
        under mild tangential agitation in a shaking plate. Repeat 2×.
      
        Mount slides for microscopic observation; therefore, deposit a 20 μL
        drop of ibidi mounting medium on the sample and cover it with a
        coverslip.
      
Dry at 20°C–23°C for 30 min or 16–18 h at 4°C.
Protect slides from light.
Pause point: Fixed samples can be
      stored at 4°C for up to several weeks before microscopy analysis.
    
        Proceed to fluorescence microscopy, typically a confocal microscopy
        equipped with a x 60 oil immersion objective. As shown in
        Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2] spike protein and RNA signal are easily
        detected around nuclei.

              Figure 2. Detection of Vero cell infection by
              in situ hybridization using RNAscope and spike protein
              (Spike)-immunolabeling
            
              Cells were infected with SARS-CoV-2 alpha variant at low MOI
              (10−2, 10−5 and 10−6 MOI) or left
              uninfected (non-infected) and incubated for 24 h at 37°C. The
              cells were labeled for viral RNA using RNAscope (pink) and Spike
              (green), and counterstained for visualization of cell nuclei with
              DAPI (blue) and infection was analyzed by confocal microscopy
              using a 60× oil immersion objective. Spike, RNA and DAPI staining,
              and the merge of the three are individually shown. Yellow arrows
              point to low although specific signal observed at low MOI. Scale
              bar: 20 μm.
